titleStmt.title: His Majesties last proposals to the officers of the armie, and his remonstrance concerning the citizens of London, and his son Charles Prince of Wales, in case he be not speedily inthroned, and restored to his just rightts and dignities. With the answer therunto. Likewise a message from the Prince to the citizens, and His Majesties desires to the Lord Gen. Fairfax, and protestation touching the army. Dated from Windsor, on Wednesday 27. Decemb. 1648. Published for generall satisfaction to the kingdom.

His Majesties last proposals to the officers of the armie, and his remonstrance concerning the citizens of London, and his son Charles Prince of Wales, in case he be not speedily inthroned, and restored to his just rightts and dignities. With the answer therunto. Likewise a message from the Prince to the citizens, and His Majesties desires to the Lord Gen. Fairfax, and protestation touching the army. Dated from Windsor, on Wednesday 27. Decemb. 1648. Published for generall satisfaction to the kingdom.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
